oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Harlan Howard interview - Songwriters Exhibit
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Harlan Howard (songwriter), for a songwriters exhibit audio guide.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Harlan Howard talks about his rituals before and during songwriting -- Howard talks about setting a schedule for his songwriting -- Howard talks about the successes of songwriting are great and all, but the biggest thrill is just finishing a song and knowing that it is really a great song -- Howard talks about influential songwriters, including Hank Thompson and Tex Ritter -- Howard talks about writing Pick Me Up On You're Way Down -- Howard talks about writing Evening Snow, and using simple words you don't hear so often -- Howard talks about loving words over melody and harmony -- Howard talks about thinking of songwriting as a game and having fun, because that's what yields the best product -- Howard talks about some techniques in songwriting -- Howard talks about being original as a songwriter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Howard, Harlan;
